required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Azacitidine to Evaluate Safety and Effectiveness for Chinese Patients With Higher Risk Myelodysplastic Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Open-Label, Single-Arm Study to Evaluate the Efficacy, Safety, and Pharmacokinetics of Subcutaneous Azacitidine in Adult Chinese Subjects With Higher-Risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of the study is to determine whether azacitidine is safe and effective in the treatment of Chinese patients with higher risk Myelodysplastic Syndromes (MDS).

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Hematologic Response Based on the International Working Group (IWG) Criteria for Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS) and Programmatically Assessed by the Sponsor Using Clinically Relevant Data.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Response initially assessed at end of cycle 6, then every 4 cycles; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
primary_outcome.description: Hematologic Response is defined by those participants who experienced a Complete Response, Partial Response and Stable Disease (SD) based on IWG 2000 response criteria for MDS. CR = repeat bone marrow (BM) shows <5% myeloblasts, and peripheral blood values lasting ≥ 2 months of hemoglobin (hgb) (>110 g/L), neutrophils (≥1.5x10^9/L), platelets (≥100x10^9/L), blasts (0%) and no dysplasia • PR = same as CR for peripheral blood: BM shows blasts decrease by ≥ 50% or a less advanced FAB classification from pretreatment • Stable disease (SD): failure to achieve a PR, no evidence of progression for at least 2 months. • Failure: death during treatment or disease progression • Relapse After CR or PR: return to pretreatment BM blast percent or decrement of ≥ 50% from remission/response levels in granulocytes or platelets; or reduction in hgb by ≥20 g/L or transfusion dependence • Disease Progression: change in blast levels • Disease Transformation to Acute Myelogenous Leukemia.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With a Hematologic Response Using IWG Criteria for MDS and Assessed by the Investigator
primary_outcome.time_frame: Response initially assessed at end of cycle 6, then every 4 cycles; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
primary_outcome.description: Hematologic Response is defined by those participants who experienced a Complete Response, Partial Response and Stable Disease (SD) based on IWG 2000 response criteria for MDS. CR = repeat bone marrow (BM) shows <5% myeloblasts, and peripheral blood values lasting ≥ 2 months of hemoglobin (hgb) (>110 g/L), neutrophils (≥1.5x10^9/L), platelets (≥100x10^9/L), blasts (0%) and no dysplasia • PR = same as CR for peripheral blood: BM shows blasts decrease by ≥ 50% or a less advanced FAB classification from pretreatment • Stable disease (SD): failure to achieve a PR, no evidence of progression for at least 2 months. • Failure: death during treatment or disease progression • Relapse After CR or PR: return to pretreatment BM blast percent or decrement of ≥ 50% from remission/response levels in granulocytes or platelets; or reduction in hgb by ≥20 g/L or transfusion dependence • Disease Progression: change in blast levels • Disease Transformation to Acute Myelogenous Leukemia.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Hematologic Improvement (HI) Based on 2000 IWG Response Criteria for MDS and Programmatically Assessed by the Sponsor Using Clinically Relevant Data.
primary_outcome.description: Hematologic improvements (HI) have 4 categories: 1. Erythroid response (HI-E): Major >20g/L increase or transfusion independent. Minor: 10-20g/L increase or ≥50% decrease in transfusion requirements. 2. Platelet response (HI-P): Major absolute increase of ≥30x10^9/L or platelet transfusion independence. Minor: ≥50% increase. 3. Neutrophil response (HI-N): Major 100% increase or an absolute increase of >0.5x10^9/L. Minor: ≥100% increase and absolute increase of <0.5x10^9/L 4. Progression or relapse after HI Hematological improvement (HI) was defined as any type (major or minor) of improvement of HI-E, HI-P, or HI-N. Criteria: Pretreatment=hemoglobin <100g/L or RBC transfusion-dependent, platelet count <100x10^9/L or platelet transfusion dependent, absolute neutrophil count <1.5x10^9/L. Sponsor's determination was derived using clinically relevant data. Denominator for progression/relapse after HI included participants who had achieved HI.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Units of Platelet Transfusions by Cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to cycle 27; The on-treatment period was considered the period from the date of first dose to the last treatment study visit; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of units of platelet transfusions received 56 days prior to treatment, considered the baseline period, (baseline period defined as the screening period before the date of the first dose of azacitidine; any laboratory and blood transfusion data reported on the day of the first dose of azacitidine was considered to be baseline data) and during study was standardized per 28 days and summarized by cycle for platelets. The formula for standardizing per 28 days was: [(# of transfusions in the measurement period / length of the measurement period (days)) x 28], where the measurement period was either baseline or the relevant cycle length.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Platelet Transfusions by Cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to cycle 27; The on-treatment period was considered the period from the date of first dose to the last treatment study visit; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of platelet transfusions received 56 days prior to treatment, considered the baseline period (baseline period defined as the screening period before the date of the first dose of azacitidine; any laboratory and blood transfusion data reported on the day of the first dose of azacitidine was considered to be baseline data) and during study was standardized per 28 days and summarized by cycle for platelets. The formula for standardizing per 28 days was: [(# of transfusions in the measurement period / length of the measurement period (days)) x 28], where the measurement period was either baseline or the relevant cycle length.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Units of Red Blood Cell (RBC) Transfusions by Cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to cycle 27; The on-treatment period was considered the period from the date of first dose to the last treatment study visit; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of units of RBC received 56 days prior to treatment, considered the baseline period (baseline period defined as the screening period before the date of the first dose of azacitidine; any laboratory and blood transfusion data reported on the day of the first dose of azacitidine was considered to be baseline data) and during study was standardized per 28 days and summarized by cycle for RBC. The formula for standardizing per 28 days was: [(# of transfusions in the measurement period / length of the measurement period (days)) x 28], where the measurement period was either baseline or the relevant cycle length.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of RBC Transfusions by Cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to cycle 27; The on-treatment period was considered the period from the date of first dose to the last treatment study visit; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
secondary_outcome.description: The number of RBC transfusions received 56 days prior to treatment, considered the baseline period (baseline period defined as the screening period before the date of the first dose of azacitidine; any laboratory and blood transfusion data reported on the day of the first dose of azacitidine was considered to be baseline data) and during study was standardized per 28 days and summarized by cycle for platelets. The formula for standardizing per 28 days was: [(# of transfusions in the measurement period / length of the measurement period (days)) x 28], where the measurement period was either baseline or the relevant cycle length.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Number of Infections (Post-baseline Average) Requiring Intravenous (IV) Antibiotics, Anti-fungals, or Antivirals by Cycle
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to cycle 27; The on-treatment period was considered the period from the date of first dose to the last treatment study visit; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
secondary_outcome.description: The on-treatment adverse event of infection requiring IV antibiotics, antifungals, or antivirals per 28 days/cycle. The overall post-baseline average is the average of number of infections requiring IV antibiotics or IV antiviral per 28 days/cycle.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan Meier Estimates for Overall Survival (OS)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Until the end of the survival follow-up period; Up to data cut-off of 29 January 2015; 894 days
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as time to death from any cause, is calculated using date of first dose and date of death, or date of last follow-up for censored participants. Those, who die regardless of the cause of death, will be considered to have an event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 29 January 2015; from the first dose of study drug to 28 days after the date of the last dose of study drug (maximum time on study was 244 days)
secondary_outcome.description: A treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAE) was defined as AEs with an onset date on or after the date of first dose and within 28 days after the date of the last dose. Any AE that occurred beyond this timeframe and was assessed by the investigator as possibly related to study drug was considered treatment-emergent. The intensity and severity of AEs was assessed by the investigator according to the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Event (CTCAE) Version 4.0. For any AEs not listed in the CTCAE grading system, the intensities of these events was assessed by the Investigator using the 5-point scale: Grade 1 = Mild, Grade 2 = Moderate; Grade 3 = Severe, Grade 4 = Life threatening, Grade 5 = Death. An SAE is any AE occurring that results in death, is life-threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, and constitutes an important medical event.

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC∞) of Azacitidine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity (AUC∞) following multiple doses of Azacitidine on Day 7; if possible, the area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity, calculated by the linear trapezoidal rule and extrapolated to infinity was calculated according to the following equation: AUC∞ = AUCt + (Ct/ λz ), where Ct is the last quantifiable concentration. No AUC extrapolation will be performed with unreliable λz. If % AUC extrapolated is ≥ 25%, AUC∞ will not be reported

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Last Measurable Concentration (AUCt) of Azacitidine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the last quantifiable time point, calculated by the linear trapezoidal rule when concentrations are increasing and the logarithmic trapezoidal method when concentrations are decreasing.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Azacitidine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: The observed maximum plasma concentration obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Azacitidine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Time to maximum observed plasma concentration obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data.

secondary_outcome.measure: Terminal Phase of Half-life (T1/2) of Azacitidine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: The apparent terminal half-life was calculated according to the following equation t½ = 0.693/λz.

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Total Plasma Clearance (CL/F) of Azacitidine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent total plasma clearance (CL/F) of Azacitidine was calculated as Dose/AUC∞

secondary_outcome.measure: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vd/F) of Azacitidine
secondary_outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution, was calculated according to the equation: Vd/F = (CL/F)/λz

arm_group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

intervention.description: Subcutaneous administration of azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day for 7 days every 28 days optimally for at least 6 cycles until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or treatment discontinuation for any other reason

facility.name: The 301 Hospital- Chinese PLA General Hospital
The Third Hospital of Peking University
West China Hospital of Sichuan University
1st Hospital Zhejiang University (The First Affiliated Hospital of Zhejiang University )
Blood Disease Hospital, Chinese Academy of Medical Science and Peking Union Medical College

participants_list.participants: Includes all participants who were enrolled into the study

Participants still on study treatment at time of study closure

baseline.population: ITT includes all participants who had been screened and enrolled into the study.

group.title: Azacitidine
group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

measure.title: Age
Sex: Female, Male
International Prognostic Scoring System (IPSS) Risk Classification
measure.description: The Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS) IPSS score assesses the severity of MDS based on 3 prognostic factors each assigned a score: the percentage of bone marrow blasts, chromosome changes in the marrow cells (karyotype) and the presence of one or more low blood cell counts (cytopenias). The IPSS score is the sum of the bone marrow blast + karyotype + cytopenia score and ranges from 0 (low risk) to 3.5 (high risk). Prognosis is categorized as Low risk (score = 0), Intermediate-1 (score 0.5 to 1.0), Intermediate-2 (score 1.5 to 2.0) or High risk (score ≥ 2.5).

measure.title: French-American-British classification (FAB)
measure.description: FAB is a classification system for five (5) subtypes of myelodysplastic syndrome that are distinguished by the percentage of myeloblasts, presence or absence of ringed sideroblasts or a monocytosis. Classification was made by the Local Reviewer.

measure.title: MDS World Health Organization (WHO) Classification
measure.description: The World Health Organization (WHO) classification recognizes eight subtypes of MDS that are distinguished by the percentage of myeloblasts, presence or absence of ringed sideroblasts (i.e., erythroid precursors with iron deposits surrounding the nucleus), presence of a monocytosis or a deletion 5q.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With a Hematologic Response Based on the International Working Group (IWG) Criteria for Myelodysplastic Syndrome (MDS) and Programmatically Assessed by the Sponsor Using Clinically Relevant Data.
outcome.description: Hematologic Response is defined by those participants who experienced a Complete Response, Partial Response and Stable Disease (SD) based on IWG 2000 response criteria for MDS. CR = repeat bone marrow (BM) shows <5% myeloblasts, and peripheral blood values lasting ≥ 2 months of hemoglobin (hgb) (>110 g/L), neutrophils (≥1.5x10^9/L), platelets (≥100x10^9/L), blasts (0%) and no dysplasia • PR = same as CR for peripheral blood: BM shows blasts decrease by ≥ 50% or a less advanced FAB classification from pretreatment • Stable disease (SD): failure to achieve a PR, no evidence of progression for at least 2 months. • Failure: death during treatment or disease progression • Relapse After CR or PR: return to pretreatment BM blast percent or decrement of ≥ 50% from remission/response levels in granulocytes or platelets; or reduction in hgb by ≥20 g/L or transfusion dependence • Disease Progression: change in blast levels • Disease Transformation to Acute Myelogenous Leukemia.
outcome.time_frame: Response initially assessed at end of cycle 6, then every 4 cycles; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) includes all participants who were enrolled into the study.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving a Hematologic Improvement (HI) Based on 2000 IWG Response Criteria for MDS and Programmatically Assessed by the Sponsor Using Clinically Relevant Data.
outcome.description: Hematologic improvements (HI) have 4 categories: 1. Erythroid response (HI-E): Major >20g/L increase or transfusion independent. Minor: 10-20g/L increase or ≥50% decrease in transfusion requirements. 2. Platelet response (HI-P): Major absolute increase of ≥30x10^9/L or platelet transfusion independence. Minor: ≥50% increase. 3. Neutrophil response (HI-N): Major 100% increase or an absolute increase of >0.5x10^9/L. Minor: ≥100% increase and absolute increase of <0.5x10^9/L 4. Progression or relapse after HI Hematological improvement (HI) was defined as any type (major or minor) of improvement of HI-E, HI-P, or HI-N. Criteria: Pretreatment=hemoglobin <100g/L or RBC transfusion-dependent, platelet count <100x10^9/L or platelet transfusion dependent, absolute neutrophil count <1.5x10^9/L. Sponsor's determination was derived using clinically relevant data. Denominator for progression/relapse after HI included participants who had achieved HI.
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) includes all participants who were enrolled into the study.

measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) includes all participants who were enrolled into the study.

outcome.title: The Number of Units of Platelet Transfusions by Cycle
outcome.description: The number of units of platelet transfusions received 56 days prior to treatment, considered the baseline period, (baseline period defined as the screening period before the date of the first dose of azacitidine; any laboratory and blood transfusion data reported on the day of the first dose of azacitidine was considered to be baseline data) and during study was standardized per 28 days and summarized by cycle for platelets. The formula for standardizing per 28 days was: [(# of transfusions in the measurement period / length of the measurement period (days)) x 28], where the measurement period was either baseline or the relevant cycle length.
outcome.time_frame: Up to cycle 27; The on-treatment period was considered the period from the date of first dose to the last treatment study visit; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) includes all participants who were enrolled into the study.

outcome.title: The Number of Infections (Post-baseline Average) Requiring Intravenous (IV) Antibiotics, Anti-fungals, or Antivirals by Cycle
outcome.description: The on-treatment adverse event of infection requiring IV antibiotics, antifungals, or antivirals per 28 days/cycle. The overall post-baseline average is the average of number of infections requiring IV antibiotics or IV antiviral per 28 days/cycle.
outcome.time_frame: Up to cycle 27; The on-treatment period was considered the period from the date of first dose to the last treatment study visit; Up to 29 January 2015; 894 days
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) includes all participants who were enrolled into the study.

group.title: Azacitidine
group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

measure.title: The Number of Infections (Post-baseline Average) Requiring Intravenous (IV) Antibiotics, Anti-fungals, or Antivirals by Cycle
measure.description: The on-treatment adverse event of infection requiring IV antibiotics, antifungals, or antivirals per 28 days/cycle. The overall post-baseline average is the average of number of infections requiring IV antibiotics or IV antiviral per 28 days/cycle.
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) includes all participants who were enrolled into the study.

outcome.title: Kaplan Meier Estimates for Overall Survival (OS)
outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as time to death from any cause, is calculated using date of first dose and date of death, or date of last follow-up for censored participants. Those, who die regardless of the cause of death, will be considered to have an event.
outcome.time_frame: Until the end of the survival follow-up period; Up to data cut-off of 29 January 2015; 894 days
outcome.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) includes all participants who were enrolled into the study.

group.title: Azacitidine
group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

measure.title: Kaplan Meier Estimates for Overall Survival (OS)
measure.description: Overall survival is defined as time to death from any cause, is calculated using date of first dose and date of death, or date of last follow-up for censored participants. Those, who die regardless of the cause of death, will be considered to have an event.
measure.population: Intent to Treat (ITT) includes all participants who were enrolled into the study.

measurement_list.measurement: The data for overall survival has not matured and does not exist as of data cut- off date of 29 Jan 2015 as the study is on-going
The data for overall survival among the 75th percentile has not matured and does not exist as of data cut-off date of 29 Jan 2015 as the study is on-going. This also applies to the upper limit.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE)
outcome.description: A treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAE) was defined as AEs with an onset date on or after the date of first dose and within 28 days after the date of the last dose. Any AE that occurred beyond this timeframe and was assessed by the investigator as possibly related to study drug was considered treatment-emergent. The intensity and severity of AEs was assessed by the investigator according to the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Event (CTCAE) Version 4.0. For any AEs not listed in the CTCAE grading system, the intensities of these events was assessed by the Investigator using the 5-point scale: Grade 1 = Mild, Grade 2 = Moderate; Grade 3 = Severe, Grade 4 = Life threatening, Grade 5 = Death. An SAE is any AE occurring that results in death, is life-threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, and constitutes an important medical event.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 29 January 2015; from the first dose of study drug to 28 days after the date of the last dose of study drug (maximum time on study was 244 days)
outcome.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least one dose of azacitidine and had at least one post-dose safety assessment

group.title: Azacitidine
group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Treatment Emergent Adverse Events (TEAE)
measure.description: A treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAE) was defined as AEs with an onset date on or after the date of first dose and within 28 days after the date of the last dose. Any AE that occurred beyond this timeframe and was assessed by the investigator as possibly related to study drug was considered treatment-emergent. The intensity and severity of AEs was assessed by the investigator according to the Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Event (CTCAE) Version 4.0. For any AEs not listed in the CTCAE grading system, the intensities of these events was assessed by the Investigator using the 5-point scale: Grade 1 = Mild, Grade 2 = Moderate; Grade 3 = Severe, Grade 4 = Life threatening, Grade 5 = Death. An SAE is any AE occurring that results in death, is life-threatening, requires hospitalization or prolongation of existing hospitalization, results in persistent or significant disability/incapacity, is a congenital anomaly/birth defect, and constitutes an important medical event.
measure.population: Safety population included all participants who received at least one dose of azacitidine and had at least one post-dose safety assessment

class.title: ≥ 1 Grade 3 or 4 TEAE related to study drug
≥ 1 serious TEAE related to study drug
≥ 1 TEAE leading to discontinuation of study drug
≥ 1 TEAE leading to dose reduction of study drug
≥1 TEAE leading to dose interruption of study drug

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC∞) of Azacitidine
outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity (AUC∞) following multiple doses of Azacitidine on Day 7; if possible, the area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity, calculated by the linear trapezoidal rule and extrapolated to infinity was calculated according to the following equation: AUC∞ = AUCt + (Ct/ λz ), where Ct is the last quantifiable concentration. No AUC extrapolation will be performed with unreliable λz. If % AUC extrapolated is ≥ 25%, AUC∞ will not be reported
outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
outcome.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

group.title: Azacitidine
group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to Infinity (AUC∞) of Azacitidine
measure.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity (AUC∞) following multiple doses of Azacitidine on Day 7; if possible, the area under the concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity, calculated by the linear trapezoidal rule and extrapolated to infinity was calculated according to the following equation: AUC∞ = AUCt + (Ct/ λz ), where Ct is the last quantifiable concentration. No AUC extrapolation will be performed with unreliable λz. If % AUC extrapolated is ≥ 25%, AUC∞ will not be reported
measure.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Last Measurable Concentration (AUCt) of Azacitidine
outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the last quantifiable time point, calculated by the linear trapezoidal rule when concentrations are increasing and the logarithmic trapezoidal method when concentrations are decreasing.
outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
outcome.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

group.title: Azacitidine
group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero to the Last Measurable Concentration (AUCt) of Azacitidine
measure.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the last quantifiable time point, calculated by the linear trapezoidal rule when concentrations are increasing and the logarithmic trapezoidal method when concentrations are decreasing.
measure.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

outcome.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Azacitidine
outcome.description: The observed maximum plasma concentration obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data.
outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
outcome.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

measure.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Azacitidine
measure.description: The observed maximum plasma concentration obtained directly from the observed concentration versus time data.
measure.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

outcome.title: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Azacitidine

outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7

measure.title: Time to Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Azacitidine

outcome.title: Terminal Phase of Half-life (T1/2) of Azacitidine
outcome.description: The apparent terminal half-life was calculated according to the following equation t½ = 0.693/λz.
outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
outcome.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

group.title: Azacitidine
group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

measure.title: Terminal Phase of Half-life (T1/2) of Azacitidine
measure.description: The apparent terminal half-life was calculated according to the following equation t½ = 0.693/λz.
measure.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

outcome.title: Apparent Total Plasma Clearance (CL/F) of Azacitidine
outcome.description: Apparent total plasma clearance (CL/F) of Azacitidine was calculated as Dose/AUC∞
outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
outcome.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

group.title: Azacitidine
group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

measure.title: Apparent Total Plasma Clearance (CL/F) of Azacitidine
measure.description: Apparent total plasma clearance (CL/F) of Azacitidine was calculated as Dose/AUC∞
measure.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

outcome.title: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vd/F) of Azacitidine
outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution, was calculated according to the equation: Vd/F = (CL/F)/λz
outcome.time_frame: PK blood samples collected at 0.25, 0.5, 1,2,3,4, 6 and 8 hours after azacitidine administration on Day 7
outcome.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

group.description: Azacitidine 75 mg/m^2/day subcutaneously (SC) for 7 days every 28 days until disease progression (DP), adverse events (AE), withdrawal of consent from further treatment, withdrawal of consent, death, lost to follow-up, or protocol violation.

measure.title: Apparent Volume of Distribution (Vd/F) of Azacitidine
measure.description: Apparent volume of distribution, was calculated according to the equation: Vd/F = (CL/F)/λz
measure.population: The PK population includes up to 12 participants with evaluable azacitidine plasma PK profile.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The investigator shall have the right to publish and/or present study data provided that the investigator shall (i) furnish the sponsor a copy of any proposed publication or presentation generally sixty (60) days in advance of the submission, (ii) delete any confidential information of the sponsor, and (iii) delay submission for generally up to ninety (90) days to permit the preparation and filing of intellectual property applications or until sponsor gives its consent in a timely manner.
